Today I focused on three main areas: account management, onboarding, and project-related tasks.1. Account Sweep & Messaging
I checked all working accounts for new requests and messages, cleared inboxes, and sent first-message templates. CRM statuses were updated to reflect the newest outreach results. Using Gemini, I generated follow-up messages for leads who accepted connection requests and sent them across all accounts. All outcomes and changes were logged in the CRM to keep pipelines accurate and up to date.2. Onboarding & Training
I conducted live training sessions for newcomers, walking them through the RE Extension, Google Scrape Extension, and correct usage of Whisper Flow. I explained our messaging templates, timing rules, and how to manage status updates in the CRM and research spreadsheet. We practiced the Old Connections task together to ensure newcomers understand relevance checks and proper cadence.


3. Lead Sourcing, Content Tasks & Roster Updates
I worked through the Google Maps spreadsheet to review companies, create CRM cards for relevant ones, and send new connection requests. After acceptances, I used Gemini to generate personalized follow-up messages. I also created four variations of LinkedIn post copy and coordinated it with the designer’s image for posting. Finally, I updated the employee workflow analysis sheet by removing three released employees and adding three newcomers to keep the roster current.
